intro: Sunaptea guangxiensis, commonly known as the Guangxi sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to southern China, specifically the Guangxi region. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
